pullRequest.title: Fault Tolerance 3.0 Metrics
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adds the new metrics being introduced for Fault Tolerance 3.0

Creates the required bundles and features required for FT 3.0
Modifies the MetricRecorder interface so it can capture the new information required for FT 3.0

Much of the FT 3.0 metrics capture the same information but structured in a different way to the 1.1 metrics, but there is some new information captured.


Update the existing 1.x and 2.x implementations to match the MetricRecorder interface changes
Implement a new MetricRecorder which produces the metrics required by FT 3.0

nodes.bodyText:
Change,
"This feature provides support for the MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 API."
to,
"This feature supports the MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 API."

+description=This feature provides support for the MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 API.

commit.message:
Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics changes

Alter the MetricRecorder interface to accommodate the new metrics added
in 3.0.

Implement MetricRecorder for the FT 3.0 metrics.

beforeCommit.message:
Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics changes

Alter the MetricRecorder interface to accommodate the new metrics added
in 3.0.

Implement MetricRecorder for the FT 3.0 metrics.

afterCommit.message:
Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics changes

Alter the MetricRecorder interface to accommodate the new metrics added
in 3.0.

Implement MetricRecorder for the FT 3.0 metrics.

nodes.bodyText: Does the auto feature need WLP-Activation-Type: parallel too?

What is the minimum version of MP Config that FT 3.0 will require? The feature file above says it tolerates 1.1-1.4 ... in which case, this build path should use the 1.1 API? I realise that is subject to change because it will probably also have to support MP Config 2.0.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.

+#*******************************************************************************

+bVersion=1.0
+
+
+Bundle-Name: com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.3.0.metrics
+Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.3.0.metrics
+
+Bundle-Description:MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics integration, version ${bVersion}
+
+WS-TraceGroup: FAULTTOLERANCE
+
+-dsannotations: \
+        com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.metrics.integration.MetricRecorderProvider30Impl
+
+-buildpath: \
+        com.ibm.ws.logging;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.logging.core;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.kernel.service;version=latest,\
+        org.eclipse.osgi;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.osgi.core;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.osgi.service.component;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.wsspi.org.osgi.service.component.annotations;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.spi;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.eclipse.microprofile.metrics.2.3;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.eclipse.microprofile.config.1.3;version=latest,\

nodes.bodyText: This class is kinda hard to read in a github diff ... do you think it needs more doc?
Should this package be com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance30.metrics.integration to avoid an future clashes?
